controller

Class Peer

  • java.lang.Object
    • controller.Peer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Peer>, java.lang.Runnable

    public class Peer
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable, java.lang.Comparable<Peer>
    Peer class. Is runnable so that a thread can run on it for networked communication in parallel to the rest of the program. Represents a connection to another computer.
    Author:
    Bit 4 - Group 4

    • Constructor Detail

      • Peer

        public Peer(java.net.Socket sockArg,
            ClientOrServer.Type type,
            ClientOrServer parentInput)
        Constructor. Creates a Peer object based in the given parameters And starts a thread on itself for reading lines from the socket
        Parameters:
        sockArg - Socket to be used for communication with this peer
        type - Whether the parent is a client or server
        parentInput - The parent to be used for this peer

      • run

        public void run()
        If the peer and its parent aren't shutting down, tries to read the next line from the socket's BufferedReader. If it reads empty data, it shuts down the peer. Else it sends it to the peer's CommandInterpreter instance.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • sendMessage

        public void sendMessage(java.lang.String s)
        Sends a message over network to the peer.
        Parameters:
        s - String to be sent

      • moveToRoom

        public void moveToRoom(Room room)
        If the peer is in a room, removes it from this room. Then adds it to the new room, and sets the peer's currentRoom field to this new room.
        Parameters:
        room - The room the peer should be moved to.

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(Peer p)
        Override of Comparable.compareTo for sorting reasons. GameRoom sorts the peers by name.
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Peer>
        Parameters:
        p - Peer to be compared to
        Returns:
        returns result of compareTo of name Strings.

      • close

        public void close()
        Ends the thread running on the peer, and closes the socket.
